text: The moment I grab the broken stone, my fingers are so stiff I can barely hold it. The blizzard roars, the Demon King’s mist surging like a living thing—I misjudge the thin point.
I throw the stone anyway—like hurling the last of my hope into an abyss.
The stone doesn’t strike a weakness. It vanishes into the mist without even a sound.
In the next instant, the mist lifts like an offended beast.
The Demon King isn’t distracted. It locks on.
Its voice grinds along my bones: “You—will—return—too—”
The whisper burrows into my ears. My knees buckle at once. Not fear—something fouler. Recognition. As if it has watched me struggle across countless loops.
The mist lashes outward, stretching into a massive claw reaching for me.
I try to retreat behind the shields, but the snow collapses under my feet. I barely raise my arm—then icy force grips my chest.
A broken gasp tears from my throat. The world slows, tightened like a wire.
And in that suspended instant, I see the necklace in Alicia’s hand—she’s about to drive it into the core.
Her fingers tremble—not from fear, but from exhaustion crashing down.
I understand at last: if she turns to save me now, she loses that half-second.
But she turns anyway.
“…Don’t look at me. Close your eyes.”
She cannot win both sides. She has to choose.
She pivots sharply, blade sweeping sideways, tearing the mist claw away from me. The darkness shrieks like ripped flesh.
That strike saves me—and steals her chance.
The Demon King’s focus returns to her completely. The mist no longer falters; it coils back like chains around her wrists and throat.
The necklace slips from her fingers, landing in the snow with a sound almost too faint to hear.
Yet that faint sound is sharper than any scream.
The Demon King’s claw descends—not a slash, but a correction. Pressing her back toward the rift, forcing the loop into alignment.
She raises her arm to block. Her shoulder armor bursts under the pressure. Blood seeps down her gauntlet, black against the snow.
She steps forward anyway—closing distance the only way she ever does: trading her life for an opening.
But this time, there is no opening.
Black light flashes—like someone erasing a piece of the world. Alicia’s form is swallowed, so cleanly that even her footprints seem to fade.
A hollow ringing fills my skull, like something shattered inside.
The barrier’s blue glow fractures, shards falling like broken glass. The soldiers’ breaths dissolve into panic.
The core in the Demon King’s chest brightens again—terribly stable. The loop continues.
The mist surges toward me. Cold pierces my chest—as if the world itself has passed judgment. As darkness consumes my sight, one thought remains: I saved myself—and lost her.

event.message:
You saved yourself.

She took the blow meant for you.

The necklace fell.
The core realigned.

The loop corrected.

This time,
the price was her.

—— A Misplaced Choice · BAD END ——
